jyVis.visualizationPrimitives
Class TextLabel

java.lang.Object
  jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.VisualizationPrimitive
      jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.Rectangle
          jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.TextLabel

public class TextLabel
extends Rectangle

A text label visualization primitive. Mouse interaction only works correctly for non-rotated text.

Author:
Curran Kelleher

Field Detail

CENTER

public static final int CENTER
A constant which can be assigned to xAlignment or yAlignment which specifies that the value of the corresponding coordinate (either x or y) defines the center point of this text label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LEFT

public static final int LEFT
A constant which can be assigned to xAlignment which specifies that the value of x defines the leftmost point of this text label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RIGHT

public static final int RIGHT
A constant which can be assigned to xAlignment which specifies that the value of x defines the rightmost point of this text label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

BOTTOM

public static final int BOTTOM
A constant which can be assigned to yAlignment which specifies that the value of y defines the bottom point of this text label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TOP

public static final int TOP
A constant which can be assigned to yAlignment which specifies that the value of y defines the top point of this text label.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

text

public java.lang.String text
text of the label

size

public double size
The size of the text. If the width of the drawing panel is 500 pixels, then this field is in the unit of points. Otherwise, the size of the text is scaled proportional to the width of the drawing panel.

xAlignment

public int xAlignment
the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's x coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.LEFT, or JVTextLabel.RIGHT.

yAlignment

public int yAlignment
the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's y coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.BOTTOM, or JVTextLabel.TOP.

rotation

public double rotation
rotation of the text

x

public double x
location of the label

y

public double y
location of the label

Constructor Detail

TextLabel

public TextLabel()
Construct a text label with no text and coordinates (0,0).

TextLabel

public TextLabel(java.lang.String text)
Construct a text label with the specified text, at location (0,0).

Parameters:
text - the text of this text label

TextLabel

public TextLabel(java.lang.String text,
                 double x1,
                 double y1)
Construct a text label with the specified text and location (the coordinates specify the center by default. This can be changed by setting the xAlignment and yAlignment fields).

Parameters:
text - the text of this text label
x1 - the x1 coordinate
y1 - the y1 coordinate

TextLabel

public TextLabel(java.lang.String text,
                 double x1,
                 double y1,
                 int xAlignment,
                 int yAlignment)
Construct a text label with the specified text, location, x alignment, and x alignment.

Parameters:
text - the text of this text label
x1 - the x1 coordinate
y1 - the y1 coordinate
xAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's x coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.LEFT, or JVTextLabel.RIGHT.
yAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's y coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.BOTTOM, or JVTextLabel.TOP.

TextLabel

public TextLabel(java.lang.String text,
                 double x1,
                 double y1,
                 int xAlignment,
                 int yAlignment,
                 double rotation)
Construct a text label with the specified text, location, x alignment, and x alignment.

Parameters:
text - the text of this text label
x1 - the x1 coordinate
y1 - the y1 coordinate
xAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's x coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.LEFT, or JVTextLabel.RIGHT
yAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's y coordinate. Either JVTextLabel.CENTER, JVTextLabel.BOTTOM, or JVTextLabel.TOP
rotation - the rotation in degrees of this text label in the clockwise direction about the point (x,y)

TextLabel

public TextLabel(java.lang.String text,
                 double x1,
                 double y1,
                 java.lang.String xAlignment,
                 java.lang.String yAlignment,
                 double rotation)
Construct a text label with the specified text, location, x alignment, and x alignment.

Parameters:
text - the text of this text label
x1 - the x1 coordinate
y1 - the y1 coordinate
xAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's x coordinate. Either "CENTER", "LEFT", or "RIGHT"
yAlignment - the way this label will be aligned with respect to it's y coordinate. Either "CENTER", "BOTTOM", or "TOP"
rotation - the rotation in degrees of this text label in the clockwise direction about the point (x,y)
